elements.title: Premna microphylla (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the leaves of Premna microphylla (pictured) are used to make a green jelly called Guanyin tofu?

elements.title: Albert Schädler (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the ideas of Albert Schädler became the founding ideas of the Progressive Citizens' Party, though he himself was opposed to the formation of political parties?

elements.title: Queen Anne Pool (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Queen Anne Pool opened to the public one day late, after a thermostat glitch accidentally heated the pool to 100 °F (38 °C)?

elements.title: Hyakuman-kai no "I Love You" (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Hyakuman-kai no "I Love You" is a popular confession song in Japan?

elements.title: a civil war in Portuguese Timor (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that upon winning a civil war in Portuguese Timor, the political party Fretilin repeatedly requested that Portuguese authorities return?

elements.title: Jacob von Eggers (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that around the age of four, Jacob von Eggers was deported to Arkhangelsk in Russia together with the entire German-speaking population of Tartu?

elements.title: A. I. Namm & Son Department Store (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that an annex to the A. I. Namm & Son Department Store included artifacts from a church?

elements.title: Military-First Girls (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Military-First Girls, a Japanese all-women fan club of the Moranbong Band, have compared their interest in North Korean music to other women's interests in K-pop and Taylor Swift?

elements.title: one of the last photographs (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that one of the last photographs ever taken of Sitting Bull shows him side by side with Buffalo Bill?
